intro: Hedyotis erecta, commonly known as the upright wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Hedyotis erecta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
